numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that legacy applicants have a higher admission rate than non-legacy applicants.
2. This is true no matter what the test scores show.
3. It appears that a non-legacy student has the best chance to enter an elite college if the student comes from a rich family.
4. I wonder why legacy students have a higher admission rate.
5. A non-legacy student can have a higher test score than a legacy student.
6. If a non-legacy student has a higher test score than a legacy student, then the non-legacy student should have a better chance of admission than the legacy student.
8. In my community, many students have the potential to go to an elite college.
9. If there are many legacy students in a given year, then some non-legacy students might be waitlisted.
10. The headline is: Do legacy students deserve an advantage?
